overview: This bill establishes the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [1] The bill repeals the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund. [1] On July 1, 2025, all appropriations and encumbrances in the repealed funds shall be transferred to the new university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund the sum of $ (HB1169) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [1] The sum appropriated shall be expended by the university of Hawaii for purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the assumptions and methodology used for financial projections. [1]
agency_impact: The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing conference center services. [1] The university may also establish accounts under the new revolving fund to facilitate its administration among the various campuses and operating units of the university of Hawaii system. [1] The university is authorized to expend funds for all costs associated with conducting conferences, seminars, and courses provided by the conference center programs. [1]
economic_impact: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the economic impact of this measure. [1]
policy_impact: This measure amends Chapter 304A, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by adding a new section to establish the University of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [1] It repeals section 304A-2272, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo. [1] It also repeals section 304A-2273, Hawaii Revised Statutes, which established the community college conference center revolving fund. [1]
revenue_sources: The bill establishes the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [1] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the revolving fund. [1] Additionally, all appropriations and encumbrances in the repealed conference center revolving fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and the community college conference center revolving fund shall be transferred to the new fund. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the six-year fiscal implications of this measure. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The university may establish and collect fees and charges for the costs of providing conference center services. [1] All fees, charges, and other moneys collected in conjunction with the conference center programs of the university shall be deposited in separate accounts within the new revolving fund. [1] On July 1, 2025, all appropriations and encumbrances from the two repealed revolving funds shall be transferred into the new university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding any capital expenditure impact. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The provided legislative documents do not contain information regarding the fiscal implications after six years. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: A previous fiscal note was not provided for comparison. [1]
fte_positions: The provided legislative documents do not mention the addition or modification of any FTE positions. [1]
appropriations_changes: A previous version of the bill was not provided for comparison of appropriations. [1] The current version appropriates an unspecified sum from the university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund for fiscal year 2025-2026. [1]
funding_sources_changes: A previous version of the bill was not provided to identify changes in funding sources. [1] The funding source for the appropriation is the newly established university of Hawaii conference center revolving fund. [1]
department_impact: A previous version of the bill was not provided to identify changes in departmental responsibility. [1] The University of Hawaii is the department responsible for expending the appropriated sum. [1]
reports_required: The university shall prepare an annual report to the legislature accounting for all income and expenditures of each separate account within the revolving fund. [1]
pilot_program: The provided legislative documents do not establish a pilot program. [1] The bill establishes a permanent revolving fund for conference center programs conducted by the university. [1]
sunset_date: The provided legislative documents do not contain a sunset date for the bill or program. [1]
effective_date: This Act, upon its approval, shall take effect on July 1, 2025. [1]
